abstract.p: French conglomerate Vivendi reports revenue increased in first half, 2000, by nine 9 percent to $17.5 billion (S)

block.p: The French conglomerate Vivendi, which recently said it was acquiringSeagram, reported that revenue in the first half-year increased 9 percent, to 19.4 billion euros, or $17.5 billion, largely as a result of growth in its television and cellular phone businesses. Revenue at Vivendi Environment, the group's water, waste management and transportation units, which were spun off as a separate company in July, increased more than 41 percent from acquisitions.
